intro: Galium dubovicii, commonly known as the Dubovicii bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically features slender stems covered in fine hairs and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Galium dubovicii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
